title: [K-12] Mobile Technology-Based Elementary Math Instructional Design Competency Enhancement Course

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary mathematics curriculum comprehension and basic digital device usage skills
context.additional_context: A course focused on learning instructional design methods for mobile device utilization in a smartphone-centric, limited technological environment.

learning_goals: Learners can apply the seven core elements required for mobile learning environment design (content, methodology, activities, assessment, technological resources, mobile resources, teacher competencies) to real-world cases.
Learners can propose at least three strategies for utilizing digital manipulatives when designing mobile-based mathematics activities to enhance learner engagement.
Learners can design a process for analyzing learning effectiveness using formative assessment tools executable in smartphone environments.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
